title: BBC Local Live: Shropshire on Friday 5 August 2016 - BBC News
summary: detectives call for dash-cam footage after fatal stabbing .
council leader backs neighbouring authority on fairer funding .
hospitals among best at referring organ donors .

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: that 's it for today 's updates .
we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on monday .

documents.title: weather : the all important weekend forecast
text: not a bad weekend ahead , the sun 's coming out and it 's staying warm .
rebecca has the details .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: football season is back
text: so while the summer has been filled with plenty of sport - wimbledon , euro 2016 , cricket and now the olym the wait for league football is finally over .
the football league season swings into action tonight and we 'll be following our shropshire teams every step of the way .
join shropshire united for all the build up of shrewsbury v mk dons and afc telford united v afc fylde from 14:00 on bbc radio shropshire .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: halstead signs one-year shrewsbury deal
text: halstead signs one-year shrewsbury deal

documents.title: badgers may not spread tb to cattle through direct contact
text: badgers may not transmit tb to cattle by direct contact , according to new research .
a study suggests that cows contract the disease by coming into contact with infected faeces and urine in pasture .
the scientists involved suggest that advice given to farmers to control the spread of the disease may need to be reassessed .
the research has been published in ecology letters .
author: Pallab Ghosh
Science correspondent, BBC News

documents.title: football : mellon has sights set on strikers
text: shrewsbury town manager micky mellon says he has a couple of strikers in his sights after being left light up front with tyrone barnett 's departure this week to wimbledon .
the town manager knows he ca n't break the bank - but he 's tracking two good players who 'd make an impact at the town .
we will look for impact and with a couple of ideas we want to pursue we 'll know very quickly whether we 'll get them over the line . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : telford and wrekin council leader gets backing ; fundraising bid to keep 'historic ' china
text: our top stories this evening :
- shropshire council leader backs neighbouring authority on fairer funding bid
- a house hit by a lorry has been demolished due to a `` high risk '' to the public
- coalport china museum hopes to raise more than £ 60k to keep hold of some of its most important pieces
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: how does rent compare in the county ?
text: in shropshire , the median annual gross salary is £ 25,574 , leaving £ 1,713 a month after tax and national insurance contributions .
experts recommend spending no more than 30 % of this on housing , which would be £ 514 .
an average studio flat costs £ 327 a month .
a similar one-bedroom property costs about £ 430 a month , while a two-bedroom home is about £ 530 .
in telford and wrekin , the median annual gross salary is £ 24,149 , leaving £ 1,632 a month after tax and national insurance contributions .
experts recommend spending no more than 30 % of this on housing , which would be £ 490 .
an average studio flat costs £ 336 a month .
a one-bedroom property costs about £ 441 a month while a two-bedroom home is about £ 542 .

documents.title: 'sky-high ' rental hotspots across england revealed
text: people spend more than a third of their disposable income on rent across large parts of england , a bbc investigation has found .
analysis shows the average rent of a one-bedroom property in almost half of all districts , boroughs and cities would cost more than 30 % of the median take-home salary for the area .

documents.title: artist works to change attitudes surrounding disability in rio
text: the opening ceremony for the rio olym is just hours away , but aside from that the games aspire to be much more .
and there 's one dimension to the rio olym that an artist has been working hard on over the last three years .
zoe partington ( right ) from cleobury mortimer is partially sighted , and as a disabled artist she 's been travelling to rio since 2013 to change attitudes about disability and disabled artists .
hear more from zoe on saturday breakfast with eric smith tomorrow from 06:00 .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : can you see me ?
text: the cows are certainly making most of the warm conditions across shropshire today .
thanks to weather watcher betton bear for this snap of what 's going on in norton in hales .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: football : telford defender say he 's lucky to still be playing
text: afc telford united 's dan preston has revealed he 's lucky to be playing after a footballing injury nearly left him paralysed .
preston has rejoined the bucks three years after leaving to join tamworth .
but shortly after his move he suffered a fractured skull in a game against leamington , leaving him with a blood clot on the brain .
he 's now made a full recovery but admits he 's lucky to be playing .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: travel : delays around shrewsbury and oswestry
text: on the a5 around shrewsbury traffic is slow after two separate incidents .
there are delays between the dobbies island and edgebold roundabout due to a broken down vehicle .
meanwhile , one lane is closed on the westbound a5 before the preston island due to a broken down vehicle .
and the a483 is blocked in both directions at the mile end roundabout in oswestry due to an accident .
you can find all the latest travel news here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: football : halstead signs new one-year deal
text: shrewsbury town goalkeeper mark halstead has signed a new contract to stay at the club for an extra year .

documents.title: bmx event arrives in telford
text: the final two rounds of the british bmx series are being staged at dawley in telford for the first time - today and over the weekend .
practice starts at 16:00 this afternoon with racing getting under way at 12:00 tomorrow .
the racers are aged from five to 56 .
setting up for the british bmx series rounds 11 & 12 !

documents.title: latest headlines : dash-cam appeal in shrewsbury murder inquiry ; house hit by lorry is demolished
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
- detectives investigating fatal stabbing believe drivers may have filmed vital footage
- hinstock lorry crash house demolished
- shropshire council leader backs neighbouring authority in fairer funding bid
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: telford rugby player describes overcoming disability
text: zac presland from telford has down 's syndrome and moderate learning difficulties , but that has n't stopped him from getting stuck into playing rugby .
the 22-year-old has written a blog about playing for the shropshire stags team , which trains in bishop 's castle .
the aim is to enable disabled players like me to take part fully in a game of rugby .
it makes me feel really happy to now have new friends who value me . ''

documents.title: council leader backs neighbouring authority on fairer funding
text: the leader of shropshire council , malcolm pate , has given his support to shaun davies , leader of telford and wrekin council in his `` fairer funding '' bid .
mr davies says they 're losing out on £ 12m every year and he wants the regions two mps to help him lobby ministers to ask for more .
mr pate says by the same calculation shropshire council 's shortfall is £ 35m per year between the authority and the average council .

if the government were to adjust funding to the average this would more than solve all of our financial difficulties in shropshire , and take the pressure off services that are not having to be so drastically cut back in other parts of england . ''

documents.title: watch : your questions to the bbc shropshire sports team
text: you can join the bbc shropshire sports team every friday at 12:30 for a facebook live chat ahead of the weekend 's local fixtures .
today 's questions focused heavily on new signings and our commentary team were pushed on how well shrewsbury town and afc telford united will do this season .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: residents moved out of newport retirement home hit by car
text: residents have been moved out of 18 apartments at a retirement home in newport because of damage caused by an out-of-control car that smashed through railings and into the building .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: hinstock lorry crash house demolished
text: here 's the scene at hinstock where a grade ii building has been demolished .
a lorry crashed into the home on the a41 at shakeford on 26 july .
shropshire council said the decision to remove the whole building had been made because it continued `` to pose a serious risk '' to the public and contractors .

documents.title: charity walkers preparing for 'jurassic hike '
text: the slightly unnerving dinosaur 's head you can see forms part of a 200kg sculpture of a t rex dinosaur .
it 's going to be carried up to the summit of mount snowdon later this month .

ben knowles from the british ironworks centre and jay moore from oswestry cambrian rotary are among those who 'll be carrying it up the mountain to raise money for the children 's charity hope house .

documents.title: headlines : police seek dash-cam footage after fatal stabbing ; council leader backs neighbouring authority
text: our top stories this lunchtime :
- appeals continue after teenage stab attack victim dies
- shropshire council leader supports shaun davies in his bid to get a 'fairer funding ' deal for telford & wrekin
- shropshire museum launches a fundraising effort to keep hold of locally made porcelain
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : delays on a5 after crash
text: traffic is slow on the a5 southbound between oswestry and nesscliffe after a four-car crash .
recovery work is under way .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: museum launches fundraising bid to keep china
text: coalport china museum is trying to raise more than £ 60k to keep hold of some important pieces of locally made china .
they 've been on loan to the museum for 30 years , but the owner is now selling up .
they include a a large blue and gold vase ( top ) and a loving cup , featuring of the forest glen , ( bottom ) .

documents.title: weather : sunny spells and light winds
text: staying fine and dry today and feeling warm .
sara has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: football : put your questions to the bbc shropshire sport team
text: starting this lunchtime , you can join the bbc shropshire sports team for a preview of the weekend 's football fixtures .
the team will be answering your questions during a facebook live session from 12:30 .
got a question for the team ?
you can email , or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: watch : presenter eric smith tries out the didgeridoo
text: on tomorrow 's breakfast show you 'll meet chris thorn .
he 's a didgeridoo player who 'll be trying to beat his record of playing the instrument for six hours tomorrow at the maws craft centre in ironbridge .
i just about managed six seconds !
author: Eric Smith
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: raf torch relay heading through shropshire
text: an olym torch relay will be making its way through the county today .
it 's to celebrate the 75th anniversary of the air training corps .
the torch is visiting raf shawbury and raf cosford later as part of its national tour .

documents.title: your cloudy skies for shropshire
text: it was a mix of sunny spells and cloud over the county yesterday .
as captured in hoptonheath ( top ) and ludlow ( bottom ) by our bbc weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : appeals continue after stab attack victim dies ; torch relay celebrates air training corps anniversary
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- police appeal for dash-cam footage after fatal stabbing in shrewsbury
- shropshire 's hospitals among best at finding organ donors
- raf torch relay heading through the county
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: could steam trains return to ironbridge ?
text: steam trains could once again be rolling through shropshire 's world heritage site .
councillors are supporting a plan that could see a heritage railway come to ironbridge .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: shropshire 's hospitals among best at finding organ donors
text: the trust that runs shropshire 's two main hospitals is among the best in the country at referring would-be organ donors .
last year , every potential donor was referred for consideration by medics - the best figures in the midlands .
not all of the patients or their families consent for donation , but due to the efforts of our staff , 25 additional transplants were carried out last year . ''

documents.title: weather : mostly fine and dry
text: expect sunny spells and light winds today .
we have highs of 22c ( 72f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: swimmer going for gold in rio
text: the former ellesmere swimming coach chris walker-hebborn says he thought about quitting the sport after a disappointing time at london 2012 .
the backstroke specialist is going for individual and gb team glory in rio .
walker-hebborn says overcoming adversity has made him stronger .
it might 've taken three years to come out of a lull for me , but i have a few runes to my name now , so i 'm glad i stuck it out . ''

documents.title: detectives looking for footage following shrewsbury murder
text: police investigating the murder of a teenager in shrewsbury on monday evening are appealing for people who may have video footage from dashboard cameras .
a 16-year-old boy , who has not been named , died from his injuries yesterday .

documents.title: headlines : detectives appeal for camera footage after stabbing ; hospitals among best at finding organ donors
text: here are some of our top stories this morning :
- officers investigating the fatal stabbing of a shrewsbury teenager want to hear from drivers in the area with dash-cams
- shropshire 's hospitals among the country 's best at referring people for organ donation
- telford to host british bmx series for the first time today
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: diversion in place of the a41 at hinstock
text: a reminder that the a41 is still shut at hinstock .
there 's a diversion route of more than 25 miles long via the a53 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: welcome to bbc shropshire local live
text: good morning .
this is your place for all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rotherham sign peterborough 's taylor
text: rotherham sign peterborough 's taylor

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : staying dry overnight
text: a dry night ahead with temperatures dropping to around 12c ( 53f ) .
rebecca has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: highlights slideshow : burwarton show 2016
text: here are some of the highlight of this year 's burwarton show .
take a look at bbc radio shropshire 's facebook page for a great gallery of photos from the day .

documents.title: on midlands today from 18:30 : memories of a summer of drought
text: in 1976 the midlands experienced its hottest summer since records began .
the appointment of an mp from the region as minister for drought helped bring the crisis to an end in august .
as i 've been finding out , the effects of the drought are still being felt 40 years on - see more on midlands today from 18:30 .
author: Bob Hockenhull
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: redundant churches sold above their guide prices
text: two redundant shropshire methodist churches have been auctioned for well above their guide prices .
the smaller one , at edgerley ( below ) near pentre fetched £ 54,000 .
that 's more than five-times the original valuation .
the other at melverley ( below ) went for £ 61,000 , three times the estimate .

documents.title: football : put your questions to the bbc shropshire sports team
text: starting tomorrow lunchtime , you can join the bbc shropshire sports team for a preview of the weekend 's football fixtures .
the team will be answering your questions during a facebook live session from 12:30 .
got a question for the team ?
you can email , or get in touch via facebook or twitter .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: biker airlifted after lorry crash
text: a woman in her 20s has been airlifted to hospital after her motorbike collided with a lorry on the a41 in hinstock .
she was thrown on to a grass verge , breaking her leg .
the ambulance service says her full leathers and helmet almost certainly saved her from more serious injuries .

documents.title: headlines : murder investigation after teenager dies ; fire rescue feline named cat of the year
text: our top stories this evening :
- a 16-year-old boy who was stabbed in a shrewsbury street dies , sparking a murder investigation
- change of minister for cremation law overhaul after baby ashes scandal
- hero cat tink from shrewsbury wins cat of the year award
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : 'got what we wanted out of pre-season ' - mellon
text: micky mellon is dismissing shrewsbury town 's mixed bag of pre-season results as no indicator for the way the season will go .
town start the new league one campaign on saturday and mellon says any defeat , goal against or miss in the build up is better than coasting through every friendly you play .
it never really works because you do n't know what you ca n't do so we got exactly what we wanted out of pre-season . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: pictures : camels at burwarton show
text: when burwarton show was launched 125 years ago in 1891 , visitors probably were n't treated to these animals .

documents.title: afc wimbledon sign striker barnett
text: afc wimbledon sign striker barnett

documents.title: watch : burwarton show cows getting ready for the main event
text: you wo n't win best in show if you have n't been vacuumed .

documents.title: house hit by lorry is demolished
text: house hit by lorry is demolished

documents.title: fire rescue feline named cat of the year
text: a fast-acting feline who alerted her owners to a house fire has been named cat of the year by an animal charity .
tink jumped on top of claire hopkinson who was asleep in bed when an electrical fault sparked a fire at a neighbouring property in shrewsbury .
her family managed to get out of the house safely but tink was overcome by the smoke and had to be revived by firefighters using a tiny oxygen mask .
tink was awarded cat of the year at the cat 's protection 's national cat awards held at london 's savoy hotel .

documents.title: change of minister for cremation law overhaul
text: dr phillip lee has been named as the new justice minister to oversee the changes to cremation laws following the baby ashes scandal in shrewsbury .
dr lee is the mp for bracknell and replaces caroline dinenage mp who 's got a new role in the department for education .

it comes as glen perkins , founder of the campaign group action for ashes , accepts a position on a new national working group to implement changes after parents were denied their children 's ashes at emstrey crematorium between 1996 and 2012 .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: teenager dies after street stabbing
text: teenager dies after street stabbing

documents.title: watch : dancing diggers at burwarton show
text: watch : dancing diggers at burwarton show

documents.title: headlines : boy dies three days after shrewsbury stabbing ; justice minister change
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- murder investigation after teenager dies following stab attack in shrewsbury
- dr phillip lee named as new minister to oversee the cremation law changes following the baby ashes scandal
- police look into fire at derelict house in oswestry
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman hacked heads off her pet snakes
text: a former prees heath woman used scissors and a knife to decapitate her two pet snakes before putting the heads in the pockets of her jogging trousers , a court has heard .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: watch : sheep shearing contest under way at burwarton show
text: interestingly , the world record for shearing sheep was broken earlier this week , with donegal man ivan scott sheering 867 strong wool lambs in nine hours .
not sure what the eagle-eyed judges at burwarton show would have made of his work .

documents.title: investigation after house fire
text: police are investigating a fire in a derelict house in oswestry this afternoon .
two engines were sent to the property on maesbury road .
breathing equipment was used to put out the fire - which started in a pile of rubbish inside the empty building .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: 85-year-old hockey player not doing it for plaudits
text: bob jameson from clun is no ordinary pensioner .
the 85-year-old is waiting for guinness world records to recognise him as the world 's oldest hockey player , but he says he is n't playing just to break records .
it would be a matter for quiet satisfaction .
i 've no wish to be known as the oldest player generally it 's got to be on merit . ''
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : history of burwarton show
text: thousands of people are expected at the 125th burwarton show in shropshire today .
it 's one of the country 's leading one-day agricultural shows .

documents.title: shropshire company secures £ 3.5m overseas contracts
text: the shrewsbury business group morris & co has secured contracts to supply low-voltage lighting towers to building sites in russia and dubai .
morris site machinery , will also provide 300 lighting towers to australia 's biggest equipment-hire firm .
company director chris morris described the orders , totalling more than £ 3.5m , as significant .
for us to be able to win against a local company out there [ overseas ] is something i think we should be very proud of . ''

documents.title: three bailed over shrewsbury stabbing
text: the boy was found in wayford close in meole brace at about 21:45 on monday after what police described as a `` targeted attack '' .
he had been in a critical condition since the attack and officers said he died in hospital this morning .
a murder investigation is under way .
three people arrested in connection with the attack have been released on bail .
we understand incidents of this nature are concerning but i would like to reassure the local community that we are doing all in our power to bring those responsible to justice . ''

documents.title: breakingteen dies after street stabbing
text: a 16-year-old boy stabbed in the meole brace area of shrewsbury on monday has died , police say .

documents.title: headlines : complete demolition for lorry crash house ; old grenade found at wellington home
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this lunchtime :
- a grade ii listed house in shropshire is having to be completely demolished after a lorry crashed into it
- wellington home cordoned off after old grenade found
- oswestry business park 'could create 1,000 jobs '
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pictures : the winner so far of cute factor at burwarton show
text: look , a baby foal at burtwarton show near bridgnorth .

documents.title: weather : dry and sunny
text: not as windy as yesterday with plenty of sunny spells .
sara has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: old grenade found at wellington home
text: a bomb disposal crew cordoned off a house in regent street in wellington last night after a resident found an old grenade there .
the device was found to be safe and west mercia police insist their actions were precautionary .

documents.title: hero tink in the running to win cat of the year
text: a shropshire cat that saved its owners ' lives when it alerted them to a fire is among those in the running to be named cat of the year today .
tink jumped on top of claire hopkinson when an electrical fault sparked a fire at a neighbouring property in shrewsbury .
it meant she was able to tell the rest of the family and get everyone to safety .

documents.title: shoppers 'very sad ' to see the end of bhs in telford
text: i 've been talking to people in telford town centre , where bhs has closed its doors for the final time .
one lady told me that our high streets are changing too quickly , but another said that prices `` were quite over-inflated '' in comparison to other shops .
dozens of workers are now looking for jobs following the firm 's collapse .
author: Julia Morgan
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lorry crash house to be completely demolished
text: a grade ii listed house in shropshire is having to be completely demolished .
a lorry crashed into the building in shakeford near hinstock last week - closing the a41 .
the work to remove fox house began this morning and it 's hoped it 'll lead to the road reopening earlier than expected .

documents.title: thousands expected at burwarton show
text: the burwarton show is open near bridgnorth .
it 's 125 years since the show started - and since then , it 's become the biggest one-day event in the county .
some 20,000 people are expected to attend .
the most important part of the show is already under way - the judging of cakes and preserves !
are you at the burwarton show today ?
send us your of the day , you can email us or get in touch via facebook and twitter .

documents.title: headlines : police quiz three arrested over stab attack ; shropshire firm secures multimillion-pound contracts
text: our top stories this morning :
- detectives continue to question three people about a stabbing in shrewsbury
- shropshire-based company morris & co celebrates winning contracts in russia and dubai
- house in wellington cordoned off last night after old grenade found .
the device was found to be safe
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: planned development 'could create 1,000 jobs '
text: more than 1,000 jobs could be created with the building of a new business park in oswestry , shropshire council says .
it 's hoped government backing for the long-planned innovation park at mile end will arrive in the autumn .
councillor steve charmley says it 'll bring huge benefits to an expanding town .
if we can bring different skill sets and different opportunities to oswestry hopefully it 'll regenerate the town . ''

documents.title: inquiries continue following shrewsbury stabbing
text: detectives are continuing to question three people today about a knife attack on shrewsbury 's meole estate .
a 16-year-old remains in a critical condition after being found with stab wounds on monday night .
officers say a group of men were seen running away from the wayford close area that evening .

documents.title: could this be the world 's oldest hockey player ?
text: bob jameson from clun has just returned from australia , where he played in the masters hockey world cup .
while he was there , he beat the current record for the oldest hockey player , which is 84 years and 170 days .
he 's sent off an application to guiness world records and is awaiting a response .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: new fears over long mynd water pollution if homes plan goes ahead
text: the building of 47 houses and a coach park next to a school could still contaminate the source of long mynd bottled spring water , the environment agency has said .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: few traffic problems , with a41 remaining closed
text: work is still in progress to demolish part of a house that was hit by a lorry on the a41 at hinstock .
other than that , the roads are looking good with some small delays because of roadworks .
you can check the latest here .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: headlines : police continue stabbing investigation ; government backs oswestry business park
text: here are some of the main stories for shropshire this morning :
- detectives continue to question three people about a stabbing in shrewsbury
- oswestry business park could create 1,000 jobs , council says
- 85-year-old from clun could soon be world 's oldest hockey player
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast
text: it will be a fairly warm day with sunny spells and scattered showers .
maximum temperature : 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: hello from the bbc in shropshire
text: good morning .
this is your place for all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Alex Seftel
BBC Local Live

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: coming up on tv : the battle at the pumps
text: we 'll be looking this evening at some good news for motorists in the midlands .
a supermarket price war at the petrol pumps has made filling up for the holidays that little bit cheaper .
we 'll be looking at why , and also why it pays to shop around across the west midlands - on bbc one from 18:30 in midlands today .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: weather : dry tonight with clear spells
text: patchy cloud this evening , but some clear spells later on and staying mild .
rebecca has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: medical centre told to improve
text: oakengates medical centre has been told to improve by inspectors .
the care quality commission says the practice on limes walk is caring , safe and effective but not as responsive or well-led as it should be .
shifnal medical practice was rated as good .

documents.title: recovery driver lends telford family his car to holiday in
text: a recovery driver has lent a telford family his car after they broke down on their way to going on holiday .
leigh burden was called out to a job in bala , in north wales , only to discover a gearbox problem that could n't easily be repaired .
he took one look at the kids in the back of the car and decided there was only one thing he could do .
i glanced and saw the kids face .
everyone needs help every now and again especially when it puts a smile on somebody 's face , it 's priceless . ''

documents.title: latest headlines : police 'should use more technology ' ; arrests after stab attack
text: our top stories this evening :
- west mercia 's police and crime commissioner calls on the force to make better use of technology
- three people arrested after teenager stabbed in shrewsbury
- recovery driver lends telford family his car after their car brakes down on holiday
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: puppet collection saved by shropshire enthusiast
text: a rare puppet collection has been saved for the nation and is on display this summer .
michael dixon from bridgnorth is the archivist of the british puppet and model theatre guild and owns the national puppetry archive .
the collection is on display in wolverhampton , thanks to lottery money .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: cricket : shropshire going for first league title in 40 years
text: shropshire will lift the minor counties title if they win their final game in two weeks ' time .
they 're back on top of the table after beating cheshire by 70 runs yesterday .
we 're delighted to be back on top of the table , hopefully we can do the business at wiltshire . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: transplant patient in appeal for people to join donor register
text: a shropshire man who is awaiting a lung transplant has urged people to think about potentially life-saving organ transplants .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: west mercia pcc 'confident ' with armed police numbers
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner says the force is well placed to react when needed .
today the mayor of london and metropolitan police commissioner said more armed police will be seen on london 's streets from now on .
home office figures last week show west mercia has 123 authorised firearms officers .
pcc john campion says he 's spoken to the chief constable about the number of firearms officers and is confident they have the right resources to respond effectively .
pcc @ twitterid spent an afternoon with @ twitterid # taskforce , discovering how resources are being used .

documents.title: bridgnorth tv recycling facility given the go-ahead
text: work is under way to develop a new tv recycling centre in bridgnorth .
twenty eight jobs are being offered at the site on faraday drive , which will dismantle flat-screen televisions and monitors .
it 'll be run by veolia , the waste and recycling contractor for shropshire council , with the work done by a combination of man and machine .
we 're buying in some robots from france and there 's a good number of jobs we 'll provide all training required . ''

documents.title: headlines : arrests as stabbed boy remains critical ; car crashes into newport house
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- three people are arrested after a teenager was stabbed in shrewsbury
- a building has been evacuated after a car crashed into a house in newport
- bhs to close its doors for the last time in telford today
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football : ogogo excited by new faces at shrewsbury
text: last season 's player of the year at shrewsbury town abu ogogo says he 's excited by the new-look squad for the coming campaign .
town have signed nine players over the summer - ready for saturday 's opener against mk dons .
i 'm sure if you ask the new boys how they 've settled in they 'll say they 've settled in very well .
it 's round the corner from saturday now , that 's what we 've been waiting for . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather watchers : looking more like summer today
text: there 's still the odd shower about but it 's sunny in many places across the county .
here 's how it 's looking in the south of shropshire .
do you have you want to share with us ?
find out how to become a weather watcher here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: new speed camera locations to target drivers near shrewsbury
text: mobile speed cameras will be used in five new locations near shrewsbury after concerns were raised by residents .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: arrests as stabbed boy remains critical
text: arrests as stabbed boy remains critical

documents.title: egg producer concerned about free range pledge
text: one of shropshire 's free range egg producers says the sector will have to expand quickly to cope with expected increased demand from supermarkets .
six major stores have pledged to stop selling eggs produced by caged hens by 2025 .
peter jarvis , who farms at withington , near shrewsbury says a change will be good for animal welfare as long as britain can keep supplying .
is the free range sector going to expand fast enough to cope ?
i 'm not convinced welfare systems in other parts of the world are as good as in the uk , so i would n't like to see imported free range . ''

documents.title: weather : feeling fresher but staying dry
text: some decent spells of sunshine today but also becoming windy .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: west midlands mep on ukip leadership shortlist
text: an mep for the west midlands , and dudley councillor , has made the shortlist of six to become leader of ukip .
bill etheridge , who 's 46 , has said ukip should stick by its `` core principles and values '' and not be `` distracted by negative influences '' .

he has called for major reform of the penal system , including restricting prisoners ' privileges , banning visits during the first six months of a sentence and an automatic 10-year increase in sentence for anyone attacking a prison officer .

he also backs far-reaching changes to the tax system , including a 50 % cut in alcohol and tobacco duty , replacing vat with a local sales tax and gradually merging national insurance and income taxes .
author: BBC Politics

documents.title: three arrests after stab attack
text: three people have been arrested after a teenager was stabbed in shrewsbury .
west mercia police say the arrests were made in the early hours of this morning and all three remain in custody .
a 16-year-old boy was found in wayford close in the meole brace area on monday evening .
he remains in a critical condition in hospital .

documents.title: car crashes into house in newport
text: a building has been evacuated after a car crashed into a home in newport .
fire crews were called to the scene at buttercross court in stafford street at 11:20 this morning .
no one was trapped in the car and crews are making the area safe .
a structural engineer is also at the scene .
specialist crews working with newport to secure the scene of a possible unstable structure

documents.title: headlines : telford 's bhs closing today ; new speed camera vans
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this lunchtime :
- bhs due to close its doors for the last time in telford today
- shropshire egg producer says free-range sector needs to expand quickly to cope with demand
- speed cameras vans to patrol several shropshire villages
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: pledge to tackle speeding drivers on narrow bridgnorth street
text: the problem of drivers speeding along one of bridgnorth 's narrowest roads will be dealt with , shropshire council has pledged .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: harry wins gold at transplant games
text: we 've been following the story of five-year-old harry maceachen from shrewsbury who , back in march , had his second liver transplant , after his original one failed .
his dad donated part of his own liver to save harry 's life .
at the weekend , harry and his dad simon took part in the transplant games .
and look who took gold in the 25m dash .
harry got gold for 25m dash @ twitterid @ twitterid @ twitterid # whbtg @ twitterid
great well done harry

documents.title: watch : shropshire athletics coach encourages stars of the future
text: ahead of the olym we 've been touring the county looking for sporting unsung heroes .
arnie wray 's been coaching athletics for 25 years in shropshire .
here he is at the shrewsbury track willing on rising stars jake akindutire and hollie williamson , who has just become an england international .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: police and crime commissioner wants force to use more technology
text: west mercia 's police and crime commissioner wants to get your views on how he plans to make the area safer .
it 's the job of john campion to hold the chief constable to account and he 's written a plan to highlight how he 'll do it .
he says he 'll fight for victims of crime and try and get more to people to report incidents to police .
we 've got an organisation that works very hard for our communities but we have n't given them the right tools to do their job effectively .
we do n't use the tools that most of us use including smart phones . ''

documents.title: telford man threw £ 12,000 of skunk cannabis out of window as police arrived
text: a telford man was caught throwing £ 12,000 worth of drugs out of his bedroom window as police arrived to raid his house .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: weather watchers : it was wet , but then that sunset
text: it was a pretty wet day yesterday , as snapped by weather watcher raj 's range in telford ( top ) , but there was a spectacular sunset - thanks to joyce cross in worthen ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: headlines : detectives appeal over street stabbing ; shrewsbury 'rat run ' to close
text: our top stories this morning :
- appeal over shrewsbury street stabbing - the teenage victim remain in a critical condition
- shrewsbury 'rat run ' closure approved by planning committee
- last day for workers at bhs in telford
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury 'rat run ' closure approved
text: plans to close a 'rat run ' in shrewsbury have been approved by shropshire council 's central planning committee .
racecourse lane which runs between welshpool road and mytton oak road to the west of shrewsbury will be blocked just south of lambourn drive and a turning head will be created .
a report to councillors said support for the plans among those who live and work on racecourse lane was `` strong '' .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: last day for workers at bhs in telford
text: dozens of workers in telford are having to look for another job , with the closure of the town 's bhs store today .
the company , sold for £ 1 by sir philip green , went into administration three months ago .
the telford shopping centre 's looking for a new tenant and says it 's talking to several retailers .

documents.title: video : lady penelope in shropshire
text: she was an iconic woman of the 60s - blonde hair , blue eyes , fabulously wealthy .
she lived in a mansion , wore designer clothes .
she even had a butler .
and now one of the original lady penelope puppets has arrived in whitchurch to be auctioned at trevanion and dean later this month .
she 's expected to fetch between £ 15,000 and £ 20,000 .
author: Genevieve Tudor
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford man sent back to jail after sex with girl
text: a 21-year-old telford man who was previously convicted of rape has been sent back to prison for committing sexual offences with a child while he was on bail .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : latest weather forecast for the west midlands
text: a mainly dry day with sunny spells and plenty of cloud , but it 'll be windy at times and this could blow on an odd shower yourway .
highs of 21c ( 70f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: headlines : last day for telford 's bhs store ; appeal over street stabbing
text: here are some of the stories we 're looking at this morning :
- bhs workers in telford to lose jobs with the closure of the town 's store today
- detectives appeal for information to identify four men seen running away from the scene of a stabbing in shrewsbury

Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : a41 still closed with diversion in operation
text: there are n't too many problems on the roads this morning , although the a41 remains shut at hinstock .
traffic is being diverted along a53 , a442 and b5062 .

text: good morning from the newsroom in shropshire .
this is your place for all the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates .

documents.title: live coverage from shropshire
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : a muggy night ahead
text: the rain should mostly clear up by this evening , but it will stay mild overnight .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: cricket : shropshire top of division after beating cheshire
text: shropshire pulled off an important win in their match with cheshire at nantwich .
shropshire declared their second innings on 204 for 6 with david wainwright 79 not out and steve leach 63 , setting cheshire 301 to win in a minimum of 87 overs .
they dismissed the hosts for 230 to win by 70 runs .
with the abandonment of the cornwall v cheshire match shropshire are now top of the western division with one match to go .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: a41 remains shut
text: a reminder that the a41 is closed in both directions between the a529 junction in hinstock and the a53 junction in ternhill , because of an accident earlier on and emergency repairs .
diversion in operation - via a53 , a442 and b5062 .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: entertainer bernie clifton coming to oakengates
text: the comedian bernie clifton has been announced as the star of this year 's pantomime at oakengates theatre .
the 80-year-old former star of the bbc children 's show crackerjack has made a name for himself riding a yellow ostrich .
he 's set to appear in sleeping beauty at the place , from 7 to 31 december .

documents.title: shrewsbury stabbing : 'thought to be a targeted attack '
text: an attempted murder investigation is underway in shrewsbury after a 16-year-old boy was found with stab wounds .
he 's in a critical condition in hospital .
police want to trace a group of men , including one in a green t-shirt , who were seen running away from wayford close in meole brace at 21:45 on monday .

documents.title: headlines : attempted murder investigation begins ; missing man appeal continues
text: our top stories this evening :
- an attempted murder investigation has begun after 16-year-old was found with stab wounds in shrewsbury
- police continue their appeal for missing shropshire man
- telford mp considers council leader request over funding
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing man : 'his parents must be ever so worried '
text: police are continuing their appeal for missing shropshire man russell blent .
officers are treating his disappearance as 'sus the 35-year-old was last seen in shrewsbury in march .
vera jones knows mr blent and says his disappearance is 'strange ' .

documents.title: telford mp considers council leader request
text: telford mp lucy allan says she 's received a letter from telford and wrekin council asking for fairer funding - and she 's considering the points raised .
the authority 's labour leader shaun davies says they 're losing out on £ 12m every year and he wants ms allan and the wrekin mp mark pritchard to help him lobby ministers to ask for more .
earlier this year shrewsbury mp daniel kawczynski intervened for shropshire council and the authority was later given an extra £ 8.5m .

documents.title: residents shocked by shrewsbury stabbing
text: people living on the meole estate in shrewsbury say they 're shocked , after a teenager was found with stab wounds in the area last night .
the 16-year-old boy remains in a critical condition in hospital .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: town councillors back motion to keep a & e in shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury 's town councillors have backed a motion to keep 24-hour a & e at the royal shrewsbury hospital ( rsh ) .
last week the same labour proposal was put to shropshire council - it refused to back it and drew up an alternative .
health bosses in the county are looking to re-organise hospital care , which could see the most serious cases going to either the rsh or the princess royal hospital in telford - but not both .

documents.title: breakingattempted murder investigation begins after stab attack
text: an attempted murder investigation has begun after a 16-year-old boy was found collapsed with stab wounds in shrewsbury .
he was found in wayford close , meole brace , last night .
he remains in hospital in a life threatening condition .

det ch insp paul moxley , of west mercia police , said in a statement : `` we are working to trace a number of men who were seen running away from the scene moments after the incident , including one who was seen wearing a green t-shirt . ''
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : teenager in critical condition ; mp responds to council funding issue
text: here are the stories we 're looking at this afternoon :
- boy found with stab wounds after shrewsbury stab attack
- telford 's mp considers points raised by council leader over funding
- cricket : shropshire set cheshire target of 301 to win three-day match on final day
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: campaigners vow to fight to keep church stretton 's pool
text: leisure centre supporters today vowed to keep fighting for a swimming pool in a county town , after shropshire council earmarked it for closure .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : football season is nearly here
text: you know the football season is nearly upon us when the annual team photo is taken .
shrewsbury town players and staff gathered at the greenhous meadow earlier for theirs .
first up for shrewsbury this saturday is mk dons at home .
join the sports team for shropshire united from 14:00 on bbc radio shropshire this saturday for all the build up to the season opener and full match commentary .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire athletics boss says russian ban is 'positive '
text: one of shropshire 's senior athletics coaches says the olympic games `` can do without russia '' until the country has a drugs testing system that can be trusted .
arnie wray , co-ordinator of the shropshire athletics academy , believes the doping scandal is a positive step because cheating is being exposed .
let 's keep going , let 's see if we can catch the lot of them and hopefully we 'll have a sport which is clean eventually

documents.title: shrewsbury stabbing : victim believed to be teenage boy
text: it 's understood the person found with stab wounds in shrewsbury last night was a 16-year-old boy .
the teenager remains in a critical condition in hospital .
police have sealed off roads in the meole brace area as they investigate what happened .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: where can i afford to live ?
text: falling home ownership has coincided with a rise in renting from private landlords , says a report from the resolution foundation .
whether you are house-hunting or just daydreaming , try using this calculator to see where in the country you could afford to live - and would it be cheaper to rent or buy ?

documents.title: headlines : man critical after stab attack ; more than 90 people turn up for planning hearing
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- a man 's in a critical condition in hospital after being found in shrewsbury with stab wounds
- shrewsbury 's town councillors have backed a motion to keep 24-hour a & e at the royal shrewsbury hospital
- planning inquiry in craven arms moves to a bigger venue
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: planning hearing moved to bigger venue
text: a planning inquiry in craven arms has been moved to a bigger venue to accommodate the 90 people who 've turned up .
the hearing , which could last up to four days , is into whether shropshire council was right to refuse an outline application for new homes at foldgate lane , near ludlow .
the council says it 'll robustly defend its decision .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: cricket : shropshire declare on 204-6
text: shropshire have declared their second innings on 204 for 6 on day three of their match against cheshire at nantwich .
the home side have been set 301 to win .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: housing plan hearing to start
text: a four-day hearing is due to start in craven arms today into plans for housing at foldgate lane , near ludlow .
the design was turned down by shropshire council but the developer has appealed , meaning a hearing with a planning inspector will go ahead .
richborough estates declined the opportunity to comment at this stage .
nearby residents have raised concerns it could lead to an even bigger development .
they 've applied for 137 houses , the site could easily take 300-400 houses and we 're frightened at what would happen at the next stage

documents.title: weather : cloudy and wet
text: it 's set to remain cloudy and drizzly across shropshire today .
highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

text: man critically hurt in stab attack

documents.title: weather watchers : misty and wet around shropshire
text: it 's a similar across the county today .
misty with plenty of rain about .
here 's how it 's looking in church stretton ( top ) and norton in hales ( below ) thanks to our weather watchers .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: hate crime reports : west mercia police figures
text: figures show hate crime reports to west mercia police have gone up 40 % comparing june 2015 to the same month a year later
june 2016 .
june 2015
source : west mercia police
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: cricket : final day - cheshire v shropshire
text: it 's the final day of shropshire 's rain-affected minor counties match against cheshire .
shropshire are 132 for 4 in their second innings - a lead of 228 runs .
earlier david wainwright took 5 wickets for 63 .
play at nantwich has been delayed due to light rain but it 's hoped day three will get underway shortly .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: man found with stab wounds in critical condition
text: a man found with stab wounds in shrewsbury last night remains in a critical condition in hospital , says west mercia police .
officers were called to the meole brace area at 21:45 yesterday .
wayford close and stapleton road are currently closed and police have appealed for anyone with information to call 101 .
police seal off stapleton road , meole brace , shrewsbury .
oh no .
what 's happened joanne ?

documents.title: breakingman found with stab wounds in shrewsbury
text: west mercia police says a man with stab wounds was found on the meole estate in shrewsbury last night .
the area around wayford close and stapleton road remains closed .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : street sealed off in shrewsbury ; appeal for missing man renewed
text: here are the main stories we 're looking at this morning :
- police seal off a street on the meole estate in shrewsbury
- detectives have renewed their appeal for a shropshire man who 's been missing since march
- a four-day hearing to start today into plans for housing at foldgate farm near ludlow
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: shrewsbury road sealed off by police
text: police officers sealed off a street on the meole estate in shrewsbury last night .
officers have been at stapleton road since 22:30 and remain there this morning .
there 's no word yet on why part of the road has been closed .

documents.title: hate crime reports to the police increase
text: reports of hate crime to west mercia police have risen by about 40 % in a year .
hereford & worcester has seen figures comparing the number of times people who came forward to the police in june 2015 to the same month a year later .
the biggest increase was in race hate crime - incidents against people 's gender , sexuality and faith also went up .
author: BBC Hereford and Worcester

documents.title: bhs closure : telford store shuts doors for final time
text: telford 's bhs store will close its doors for the last time tomorrow .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: desperate appeal after shrewsbury man 's 'sus disappearance
text: police searching for missing shrewsbury man russell blent say his parents are desperate to find him .
det ch insp neil jamieson , who has been trying to find the 35-year-old since he was reported missing in april , says there are `` real concerns about what has happened '' .
the disappearance is also described as `` completely out of character '' .

documents.title: watch : summer reading challenge at shropshire libraries
text: roald dahl is the theme for the summer reading challenge at libraries throughout shropshire .
and at southwater library , in telford , it 's not just about books .
milo , aged six , says it 's also about stickers , medals , rainbow glasses and door hangers .

documents.title: headlines : police appeal after sus disappearance ; shrewsbury street sealed off
text: here are the main stories we are working on this morning :
- police say shrewsbury man 's 'sus is 'out of character '
- officers have sealed off a street on the meole estate in shrewsbury
- shropshire athletics boss describes russian doping ban as a positive move
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : a41 remains closed , and congestion on the a519
text: the a41 is still shut between hinstock and tern hill following last week 's lorry crash .
an accident also means there are severe delays in both directions on the a519 , on the staffordshire border near newport .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning and welcome to our live page for shropshire
text: good morning from the bbc newsroom in shropshire - we 'll be bringing you all the latest news , sport , travel and weather .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .

BBC Local Live

documents.title: man 's disappearance 'sus
text: man 's disappearance 'sus

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: weather : heavy rain on the way
text: a wet night this evening but clearing up overnight .
here 's charlie with the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: statue unveiled at telford hindu centre
text: telford 's hindus are celebrating the installation of a sacred statue .
the marble deity of lord krishna is the last of three to be unveiled at the former council building in dawley bank , which was bought seven years ago .
it 's been transformed into a hindu temple and education centre .

documents.title: council leader seeks help with 'fair funding fight '
text: telford & wrekin council leader shaun davies has written to the borough 's two mps to ask for their help in lobbying the government to get a `` fairer funding deal '' .
mr davies says the government 's own figures show the area has £ 12m less per year than the average council to spend on front-line services .
he 's asked wrekin mp mark pritchard and telford mp lucy allan to work alongside the council .

documents.title: man dies at aqueduct on shropshire border
text: a man has died at pontcysyllte aqueduct just over the welsh border .
the man , believed to be in his 20s , has not been identified and north wales police say inquiries are ongoing .
the death is not being treated as sus
anyone with information is asked to call the police on 101 .

documents.title: whitcliffe common trees : your comments
text: the controversy over whether or not to fell two young oak trees on whitcliffe common in ludlow has got you talking on our facebook page .
lesley tomlinson writes : `` unless trees are diseased , they should be left where they are .
these trees have been on this earth longer than we have - and should be here long after we 've gone ! ''
iain kelly burns had this to say : `` sympathetically sculptured .
best of both worlds .
trees stay , view returns . ''
muriel grenfell-hill commented : `` leave them please !
they are part of the view !
if you walk along the top of the common , there are plenty of uninterrupted views of ludlow ! ''

documents.title: football : barnett leaves shrewsbury town
text: tyrone barnett has left shrewsbury town after it was mutually agreed that his contract would be cancelled .
he joined the club in 2015 and went on to make 39 appearances , scoring eight goals .
shrewsbury town have thanked him for his hard work and dedication .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : shrewsbury man 's disappearance 'sus council leader asks for 'fairer funding ' help
text: our top stories this evening :
- police treat disappearance of a shrewsbury man as sus
- telford & wrekin council leader asks mps to lobby government for `` fairer funding deal ' ''
- oak trees are at the root of a row between ludlow town council and the friends of whitcliffe common
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: whitcliffe common trees : why they should stay
text: ludlow town council is hoping to save two young oak trees on whitcliffe common from the axe .
the friends of whitcliffe common have applied for planning permission to fell the trees because they say they are obstructing the view of the town .
councillors andy boddington and tracey huffer want to keep the trees because they say they enhance the view .
they want to cut down two healthy oak trees to improve the view stand a bit to the right or stand a bit to the left and ignore them .
i simply ca n't countenance cutting down health oaks . ''
i can remember these oaks as baby oaks i like them and i think it would be absolutely terrible to cut them down . ''

documents.title: watch : meet former triathlete ted hoy
text: it 's just four days until the olympic games gets under way in rio .
and it got us thinking about veterans and unsung heroes who 've flown the flag for their sport in shropshire .
you can hear their inspiring stories on the breakfast show this week .
here 's ted hoy from oswestry .
he 's 88 years old , and still swims and cycles .
he only stopped competing in world triathlon competitions at 81 .
author: Eric and Clare's Breakfast Show

documents.title: man 's disappearance now treated as sus
text: the disappearance of a man from shropshire five months ago is now being treated as sus say west mercia police .
russell blent , 35 , has n't been seen since march .
he was last seen in the meole brace area of shrewsbury , although he 'd also recently spent time in bridgnorth .
police say it 's completely out of character for him to be missing so long , especially as he has n't claimed any benefits or followed other parts of his usual routine .
officers say his family are desperate for news about his whereabouts .

documents.title: whitcliffe common trees : why they should go
text: two immature oak trees are causing conflict between ludlow town council and the friends of whitcliffe common .
some of the friends want the trees felled because they say they are obstructing the view of ludlow .
they 've applied for permission to take them down saying it 's in their remit to keep the view clear and that the benefit to the wider common should be taken into consideration .
if we are never going to be allowed to cut down a healthy tree that view will go . ''

documents.title: on air : how changes to disability living allowance affected one family
text: this is mel and her five-year-old son ethan from shrewsbury .
i 've been talking to mel about ethan 's disability and the recent changes to disability living allowance .
more from mel this afternoon with vicki and mark .
author: Vicki Archer
Presenter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : man 's disappearance 'sus tree felling row in ludlow
text: our top stories this afternoon :
- the disappearance of a man from shropshire five months ago is now being treated as sus
- man dies at pontcysyllte aqueduct over the welsh border
- controversy over whether to fell two young oak trees in ludlow
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : shropshire on top in cheshire clash
text: shropshire have the upper hand on day two of their three-day match against cheshire .
cheshire have been bowled out for 234 in their first innings with david wainwright taking 5-63 .
shropshire go into their second innings with a lead of 96 runs .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: whitcliffe common trees : should they stay or should they go ?
text: there 's controversy brewing in ludlow over a pair of oak trees currently growing on whitcliffe common .
they 're thought to be around 50 years old , and fit and healthy - but the friends of whitcliffe common have applied for planning permission to take them down .
the town council are n't sure that 's a good thing .

documents.title: over £ 7,000 raised in memory of shifnal dad
text: more than £ 7,000 was raised in memory of a much-loved father and husband who died suddenly last month .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: watch : 'made in telford ' mural complete
text: our made in telford mural project took centre stage all last week and the finished product is still in place in telford shopping centre for you to have a look at .
it 's a 16ft wide , 6ft high canvas commemorating all things telford and shropshire created by a local graffiti artist .

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers face champions in season opener
text: telford tigers ' league fixture list is out - and they face a tough first match .
they 'll start their english premier league campaign away to champions basingstoke bison on saturday 10 september .
their first home game is 24 hours later , sunday 11 september , against manchester phoenix .
tigers hockey uk
tigershockeyuk
here it is , folks !
the fixture list for the new season now , who 's getting a little bit excited ?
tigershockeyuk.com/2016/08/tigers
here it is , folks !
the fixture list for the new season now , who 's getting a little bit excited ?

documents.title: watch : river severn otters get up close with camera crew
text: coming up on midlands today at 13:30 on bbc one - the return of the otter .
from the brink of extinction in the 1980s - experts say that otters are now thriving on the river severn .

documents.title: repair works at southwater
text: two repair jobs will start at the southwater development in telford today .
following the car catching fire at the car park in june , it will be fully closed for one week for refurbishment .
and over the next four weeks , electric cables are being laid for the new meeting point house .

documents.title: latest headlines : rural crime cost rises ; tigers to face tough first match
text: here are the some the stories making the news today :
- rural crime cost shropshire over £ 750,000 in 2015 , according to report
- a man arrested in shrewsbury on sus of conspiracy to supply class a drugs
- telford tigers to face champions in league opener
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : cheshire v shropshire
text: it 's day two of shropshire 's three-day match against cheshire at nantwich .
yesterday shropshire made 330 and took a lead of 287 runs into the second day of play .
a couple of wickets have already gone , and a short time ago cheshire were 121 for 3 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: weather : wet afternoon ahead
text: cloud building up throughout the afternoon with heavy rainfall expected .
charlie has the forecast .
author: BBC Weather

documents.title: rural crime costs up on previous year , says report
text: a report out this morning from nfu mutual says rural crime cost the midlands £ 6.6m last year - up around 10 % on 2014 .
in shropshire , rural crime cost the county £ 750,000 in 2015 .
it is also becoming more high-tech , with criminals cloning tractor identities and stealing gps computer systems .
it 's almost a game of leap frog to try and stay one step ahead of these thieves . ''
author: Ian Perry
BBC Radio Shropshire

documents.title: football : town beaten 4-1 by hibs
text: shrewsbury town 's pre-season is over and it ended with a 4-1 defeat at home to scottish side hibernian .
town start their 2016-17 league one campaign against mk dons at greenhous meadow this saturday and the manager micky mellon admits they must improve .
former shrewsbury striker grant holt was on target for the visitors while new signing jim o'brien got town 's consolation goal .
i think the main thing is we need to pass the ball better and have sharper movement and defensively we were poor at times .
it is all stuff you want to happen now so you can work on it next week .
it is pre-season and these things happen .
you ca n't overreact to it but you have to react to it . ''
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather watchers : cloudy skies over shropshire
text: heavy rain is forecast this afternoon , and it 's a cloudy over most of the county .
here 's how it 's looking in myddle thanks to weather watcher len ticular .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'more police needed ' if new estate is built in oswestry
text: more police staff would be needed if a new mini-village is built on the edge of a market town .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: cricket : cheshire v shropshire
text: shropshire lead cheshire by 287 runs , going into day two of their three-day game at nantwich .
shropshire posted 330 thanks to 114 runs from scott elstone and 95 from david wainwright .
cheshire are 43 for one .
play resumes at 11:00 .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : young children left at home alone ; hinstock lorry crash house work starts
text: our top stories this morning :
- claim that children as young as eight being left home alone in the county , during the school holidays
- work starts on lorry crash house
- insurance company says rural crime cost the county more than £ 750,000 last year
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work starts on lorry crash house
text: work starts today to demolish part of a house near hinstock , after a lorry crashed into it last week .
the a41 will be closed until the middle of the month and diversions are in place .
the driver was n't injured , and the owners of the property were n't at home that evening , but fox house is a listed building , so the demolition needs to be done carefully , piece by piece .
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire prison attacks double in one year
text: assaults on fellow inmates and prisoner deaths are at their highest level in almost two decades at the county 's only prison .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: headlines : young children left home alone ; listed building to be partially demolished
text: - children as young as eight left at home alone during the school holidays
- work starts to demolish part of a listed building near hinstock , after a lorry crashed into it
- shrewsbury town well beaten in final pre-season friendly
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : a bright start will turn to rain
text: a sunny start will become a wet afternoon with temperatures today peaking around 17c .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: travel : a41 closed
text: the a41 is closed in both directions between hinstock and ternhill due to emergency repairs after an accidents .
a diversion is in place .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: good morning
text: hello from bbc local live for shropshire .
we 're in the bbc shropshire newsroom to share the latest news , sport , travel and weather with you .
if you 'd like to get in touch you can email , tweet or comment on our facebook page .
author: Mark Elliott
Reporter, BBC Shropshire
